content.description: Start 2 hands in horizontal break at chest height.  Strenuous moves up to next break, topout.
content.protection: Pads, spotter is nice, tree right behind you.
content.location: Face and blunt arete to right of Almost Left Behind.

content.description: Stand start on an undercling and move up positive edges on this 5 degree pitched face. Top out easily. Its tall, but only a few large moves to the top.
content.location: The first route you see as you approach barrel ridge. This route is the start of the ridge.

content.description: start on Arete right of Welcome to the top move up using side pulls and the large foot but Tread lightly for the foot might break some day.  For full value try not to use center pocket from Welcome to the top.
content.location: Right side of welcome to the top at Barrel Ridge

content.description: Climbs arete powerfully, using pinches, crimps, heel hooks, and a throw. Sit start adds a grade in difficulty but not in aesthetics.
content.location: Left side of the ridge, about 20 feet past Welcome to the Top.

content.description: Very fun overhanging arete that leads into a vertical arete topout. Low to the ground much of the way. For those who have done Kings throne at Westby, this is nearly the exact same route, the lower section is just a few moves longer. SDS.
content.location: Boulder just off of the ridge below fairytale land and it gets nervous.

content.description: Start is just left of the right arete on small crimps. The route stays on the face using crimps and a long move to reach the top. An easier variation to this route moves to a large jug on the right arete and tops out using some small holds on the face and around the corner.
content.location: Just right of Early Release. Boulder facing away from ridge.

content.description: Start on a set of lieback/underclings. Move to the left, pull a sharp gaston (or super reachy move if your tall)  then top out easily....in the moss. A bit more brushing would make it a more classy route.
content.protection: Pad, spotter for the gaston move.
content.location: 5 feet left of Welcome to the Top. Tops out just right of a large rectangular block perched half off the edge.

content.description: Small boulder start on right arete , work up and left.
Small crimps on a vertical face, crux is making good use of the small feet.

Slab, balance oriented slab route ending with a tough gaston or two. Stay off the mossy fern covered  ledge for full value (and cause its purty). High exciting topout. (Route is somewhat reminiscent of Feels like butter at Rib mountain)
content.location: on the ridge proper, behind two large trees. Just right of fairytale land.

content.description: Start on top of a freshly fallen block using underclings. Follow the left arete and top out on the flat platform.
content.protection: Poor landing...as of recently. Spotters may help

content.description: Start on low holds and traverse horizontally into the overhanging arete, move up to large flat ledge on corner and traverse off and around the corner. This route does not top out (ends at top of beached whale).
content.location: Start 5 feet left of the ridges last overhanging corner/arete. 10 feet left from FL, and IGN.

content.description: Sloping crimps lead into a faintly right leaning crack, on a face speckled with with small golden crimps. Fun movement the whole way, the crux comes low on the route as you get into the first crack hold. Top half is intimidating due to the height, but fear not ye for the lip is full of awesome jugs.
content.location: Left of It Gets Nervous, on the ridge proper. Look for the clean corner just above a large detached boulder that has several routes on it.

content.description: Squat start in diagonal undercling rail, move up to two good crimps. Head up using some small slopes on the left and underclings on the right. The crux is squeezing hard enough to bring your feet up high enough to reach the final pocket.  As with its neighbor to the right the sit start does add some difficulty but just isn't that fun.
content.location: Face or very blunt arete just left of Testtickler

content.description: Starts on small right hand crimp and move up and left to a sloper. Crux is either groping the sloping mini prow, or a throw to a small positive hold just at the top of the prow. Fun foot work and body positions on this.
content.location: On backside of boulder facing away from ridge. This is the left most route just next to small tree.

content.description: Squeeze the blunt arete up to a good left hand jug, then end on the big horizontal break. Traverse off easily left or right. If you are very bold (or silly) you could top it out.
content.location: Left of testtickler 10feet, in front of a pile of large boulders.

content.description: Climb pocketed face to a big horizontal break. no top out.
Climb the arete up and to avoid scary top out move left sooner then later
content.location: twenty feet right of welcome to the top

content.description: Move up the blunt arete using a sloper and a couple crimps. Pull your feet onto the main face and throw for the top corner. Feels like it ends too soon.
content.location: Wide blunt arete between Welcome to the Top and Pale Gardener

content.description: Barrel Ridge Proper is the actual ridge not including the Sandbox Boulder and the ABC boulder which are seperate.  A nice ridge of mostly solid sandstone with problems around 15 feet tall, some perhaps taller and some shorter.  Pad and spotter recommended.
